channels.summary: Academic-focused sharing of OSINT-related research, datasets, programs, and ethics/media discussions, plus some practical career/etiquette advice.

highlights.title: Reuters Institute: Israel-Gaza war shows power and limits of open-source reporting
highlights.details: Shared analysis on how open-source reporting has shaped coverage of the Israel–Hamas war, including both its strengths and constraints in conflict journalism.

highlights.title: 404 Media: AI agent that evades survey-bot detection
highlights.details: Article on a research AI agent that can complete online scientific surveys while evading detection 99.8% of the time, raising concerns about contamination of social science datasets and the broader knowledge ecosystem.

highlights.title: ProPublica RX Inspector generic drug data
highlights.details: Database and investigation offering granular data on the quality and supply chain of generic drugs, intended to significantly lower barriers for academic research into pharmaceutical manufacturing and safety.

highlights.title: Utrecht Open Source Global Justice Investigations Lab
highlights.details: OSINT-focused lab at Utrecht University working on global justice investigations, suggested as a point of contact or collaboration for academic projects.

highlights.title: Queen’s Belfast GLAN programme
highlights.details: Link to Queen’s University Belfast programme connected to the Global Legal Action Network (GLAN), relevant for those interested in law, accountability, and open-source investigations.

highlights.title: Ethics of death voyeurism in media and photojournalism
highlights.details: Two linked pieces (NYT op-ed and Guardian article) on the impact and ethics of publishing "moment of death" imagery, shared as thought-provoking material for teaching and research.

highlights.title: Terry Tao responds to claims about research suspension at UCLA
highlights.details: Member sought confirmation on rumors about Terence Tao’s research being suspended under a Trump-era crackdown on UCLA; follow-up links directly to Tao’s own post clarifying the situation.

highlights.title: OSINT-related academic work on immigration and elections
highlights.details: Links shared to Ben Zipperer’s analysis on immigration enforcement and a working paper/report (DOGE_Bellodi_Lee) on political behavior, suggested as relevant empirical research for academia-minded members.

mentions: Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism
Open Source Global Justice Investigations Lab
US Department of Housing and Urban Development

channels.summary: Moderators shared organizational updates, new investigations, calls for participation, and upcoming/recorded Stage Talks, especially on US federal enforcement, munitions, and challenges.

highlights.title: Bellingcat investigation of US federal enforcement actions in Washington, DC
highlights.details: Summary announcement of work documenting 42 verified encounters involving federal agents in DC (many with DC police), including traffic stops that escalated to detentions and aggressive actions against workers.

highlights.title: Stage Talk recording: Identifying Explosive Ordnance
highlights.details: Recording of a Stage Talk on identifying different types of explosive ordnance and current EO use in conflicts, offered as an educational resource after resolving initial tech issues.

highlights.title: Stage Talk: Open Source Munitions Portal
highlights.details: Announcement and recording link for a Stage Talk about the Open Source Munitions Portal, covering how to research and classify munitions using open sources.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Open Source Challenge puzzle platform
highlights.details: Members were directed to the Bellingcat Open Source Challenge site for regularly updated OSINT puzzles, with encouragement to discuss methods and solutions in the server.

highlights.title: Decades-old murder investigation using open source methods
highlights.details: Announcement of a YouTube video where a Bellingcat researcher demonstrates how to apply open-source techniques to reconstruct a decades-old murder involving mafia, gamblers, and pigeons.

highlights.title: Russia’s shadow fleet grain shipment from occupied Crimea to Saudi Arabia
highlights.details: Bellingcat and Lloyd’s List uncovered another case of grain exported directly from a sanctioned Crimean port to Saudi Arabia via Russia’s shadow fleet, expanding prior sanctions-evasion findings.

highlights.title: Upcoming Stage Talk with DoubleThinkLab on inauthentic accounts and FIMI
highlights.details: Announcement of a Stage Talk featuring Jasper Hewitt from DoubleThinkLab on monitoring inauthentic accounts, foreign information manipulation and interference (FIMI), and training for journalists and researchers.

highlights.title: Investigation into ICE raids and use of force in Illinois
highlights.details: Weekly round-up linked to Bellingcat and Evident Media’s investigation assessing the conduct and force used in ICE raids in Illinois, including context from a recent court order.

channels.summary: Members proposed geolocation exercises in China and Myanmar, focusing on obscure aerial/bases and island comparisons.

highlights.title: Airship/balloon infrastructure in remote China
highlights.details: Prompt to investigate airship and balloon facilities in remote areas of China, including a hangar and mooring pole site, as potential OSINT case studies.

highlights.title: Comparative geolocation challenge for Myanmar islands
highlights.details: Invitation to compare two islands off Myanmar’s coast using imagery and mapping tools, with reference to a prior Discord message as the starting point.

channels.summary: Discussion focused on recent art thefts, cultural goods trafficking cases, new archival resources, and document troves linked to Jeffrey Epstein-related art transactions.

highlights.title: Theft of 300 silver pieces from Zilvermuseum Doesburg
highlights.details: Article describing a major silver theft at the Zilvermuseum Doesburg in the Netherlands, used as a case study of museum theft-for-commodification.

highlights.title: Harvard Law School Library’s digitized Nuremberg Trials collection
highlights.details: Announcement that Harvard has released a fully searchable digital collection of evidentiary documents and trial transcripts from all 13 Nuremberg Trials, noted as highly useful for WWII-era provenance and claims work.

highlights.title: Europol-coordinated bust of cultural goods trafficking network
highlights.details: Europol press release on a major operation led by Bulgarian authorities that dismantled a network trafficking cultural goods across Europe and beyond, resulting in 35 arrests.

highlights.title: Epstein-related subpoenas to Christie's and Sotheby's
highlights.details: Discussion of a 2020 civil forfeiture suit in which Christie's and Sotheby's were ordered to disclose all correspondence and dealings with Jeffrey Epstein, highlighting a large corpus of high-value art transaction data that could be mined for investigative leads.

highlights.title: Document redactions and UBS/Maxwell financial records
highlights.details: Commentary on odd redaction practices in documents involving UBS private wealth management staff and Maxwell, pointing out potential for OSINT review of financial flows tied to high-net-worth clients.

channels.summary: Channel carried links and notes on China-related power dynamics, elite corruption in Cambodia, and US–Vietnam planning vis-à-vis China.

highlights.title: NYT coverage of Chinese general involved in Tiananmen history
highlights.details: Shared New York Times article on a Chinese general tied to Tiananmen Square, relevant to understanding contemporary Chinese elite politics and historical memory.

highlights.title: Cambodian tycoon Chen Zhi deported to China
highlights.details: Report on Chen Zhi (Vincent Chen), founder of Prince Holding Group, being deported to China amid allegations of human trafficking-linked scams and forced labor schemes worth around $10 billion.

highlights.title: AP: US–Vietnam war planning in context of China
highlights.details: AP News piece on Vietnam–US war planning and strategic considerations around China, shared for regional security context.

channels.summary: Members discussed OSINT tools and techniques for tracking aircraft and accidents, plus noteworthy military surveillance flights and regulatory issues around launches and air safety.

highlights.title: Tweetdeck-style interface for LiveATC feeds
highlights.details: Blog post by Ian Servin explaining how to build a Tweetdeck-like dashboard for monitoring multiple LiveATC streams, useful for real-time aviation OSINT.

highlights.title: Bluesky account tracking ICE aircraft via OSINT
highlights.details: Recommendation of a Bluesky account that systematically follows ICE aircraft movements using open sources, suggested for those interested in migration enforcement aviation.

highlights.title: ProPublica: SpaceX launches and airline safety risks
highlights.details: Investigation into how SpaceX’s launch activities, FAA oversight, and airline operations intersect to create safety concerns over Florida and the Caribbean.

highlights.title: NTSB preliminary report on UPS Flight 2976 crash
highlights.details: Link to the NTSB page for the UPS 2976 crash in Kentucky, flagged as an investigative update for those tracking aviation incidents.

highlights.title: Using Airnav Radar with ADS-B Exchange to infer blocked flight destinations
highlights.details: Tip that Airnav Radar’s filed flight plan overlay, combined with ADS-B Exchange data, can reveal the origin, route, and likely destination of privacy-blocked aircraft early in their flight.

highlights.title: Unusual deployment of WC-135 "nuclear sniffer" aircraft
highlights.details: Members noted WC-135 activity as atypical compared to more common RC-135 flights, highlighting that only three WC-135s exist and their role in sampling the atmosphere for nuclear detonations.

channels.summary: Conversation centered on terminology and misuse of so-called "less-lethal" munitions in protest policing, plus a new 3D-printed military drone project.

highlights.title: Debate over "less-lethal" vs "less-than-lethal" terminology
highlights.details: Several messages clarified that in academic and human-rights contexts, "less-lethal" is preferred because these munitions can and do cause deaths, challenging the misleading implication of "less-than-lethal."

highlights.title: Use-of-force standards for less-lethal munitions
highlights.details: Reminder that firing less-lethal munitions at the head or chest constitutes excessive force and police brutality, since they are intended for non-vital areas like limbs or abdomen.

highlights.title: US Marine Corps develops NDAA-compliant 3D-printed HANX drone
highlights.details: Tom's Hardware article on the HANX modular 3D-printed drone, designed by the US Marine Corps with roles ranging from reconnaissance to one-way attack, and built to comply with US NDAA requirements.

channels.summary: Shared mapping resources for Central Asian militaries and several articles on Armenia–Azerbaijan tensions, Russian troop movements, and disinformation narratives about biolabs.

highlights.title: Oxus Society visualization of Tajikistan military units
highlights.details: Link to an Oxus Society interactive visualization mapping Tajik military units, useful for regional order-of-battle and force posture analysis.

highlights.title: Upcoming interactive map of 620+ Uzbek military facilities
highlights.details: Member noted they are close to releasing an interactive dataset mapping more than 620 military facilities across Uzbekistan, indicating substantial forthcoming OSINT infrastructure.

highlights.title: DFRLab report on "biolabs" narratives in Armenia
highlights.details: Commentary on a DFRLab report showing how the biolabs disinformation narrative, previously seen in Ukraine, is being repurposed in Armenia and tied to CDC and USAID, including attacks on scientific conferences.

highlights.title: Clarifying "initialed" vs "signed" in Armenia–Azerbaijan peace agreement
highlights.details: Shared Clash Report tweet and analysis explaining that the peace deal was "initialed"—agreeing on language and intent—rather than fully signed and ratified, correcting common misinterpretations.

highlights.title: Moscow accelerates troop buildup in Armenia
highlights.details: Euromaidan Press piece on increased Russian troop deployments to Armenia amid rising tensions with Azerbaijan, flagged for those tracking the regional security balance.

highlights.title: NKobserver update on regional developments
highlights.details: Tweet by NKobserver shared as a monitoring item on regional security or political events (exact content via external link).

channels.summary: Channel saw appreciation for contributors and one detailed completed geolocation of residential damage in Kherson oblast.

highlights.title: Geolocation ID 2547 – Kozats'ke & Vesele, Kherson (residential damage)
highlights.details: User provided precise coordinates for multiple photos in a Kherson residential area, with Google Maps and Telegram source links, contributing to a structured geolocation database.

channels.summary: Discussion focused on Bellingcat’s Stage Talks podcast episodes, the Bellingcat Toolkit, new communication channels, the annual report, and a phishing warning.

highlights.title: Stage Talk: Tracking a lost Brueghel with Arthur Brand
highlights.details: Announcement that the Stage Talk with art detective Arthur Brand on recovering a lost Brueghel painting is available as a podcast episode via the Bellingcat Stage Talks RSS feed.

highlights.title: Stage Talk: US immigration raids
highlights.details: Link to a Stage Talk episode on US immigration raids, giving context and methodology behind Bellingcat’s related investigations.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Toolkit one-year anniversary
highlights.details: Reminder that the revamped Bellingcat Toolkit has been live for a year, serving as a curated library of OSINT tools with use cases, guidance, and volunteer-written reviews.

highlights.title: Bellingcat 2024 Annual Report
highlights.details: Publication of Bellingcat’s 2024 annual report, summarizing investigations, impact, and lessons learned.

highlights.title: Bellingcat WhatsApp news channel
highlights.details: Announcement that Bellingcat now runs a WhatsApp channel for those who prefer direct messaging over social media feeds, providing investigation and update alerts.

highlights.title: Stage Talk: Mapping Central Asia’s armed forces
highlights.details: Podcast episode featuring Oxus Society’s Michael Hilliard and Bellingcat contributors on how logistics and mapping projects inform our understanding of "military power" in Central Asia.

highlights.title: Phishing alert: fake emails posing as Bellingcat staff
highlights.details: Security notice urging users to report suspicious emails from alleged Bellingcat staff to a central contact email, linked to a public warning post on Bluesky.

channels.summary: A member shared detailed findings from an OSINT investigation into a coordinated Latin American bot network identifiable via a Go/Golang error pattern.

highlights.title: LATAM coordinated bot network identified via Go formatting error
highlights.details: Investigation documented 70+ accounts across Colombia, Argentina, Mexico, Guatemala, and Peru sharing a distinctive Go "%!(EXTRA string=...)" formatting error, posting in synchronized bursts and amplifying conflicting political content, suggesting a centrally operated influence network.

channels.summary: Channel activity featured new members, environmental OSINT tools, climate-impact news, and educational resources on environmental monitoring and toxicology.

highlights.title: Nusantara Atlas deforestation viewer
highlights.details: Interactive map for visualizing deforestation in Indonesia, Malaysia, Brunei, Papua New Guinea, and Colombia, recommended as a go-to resource for land-use and forest-loss analysis.

highlights.title: Mosquitoes appear in Iceland as climate warms
highlights.details: Guardian report on mosquitoes being detected in Iceland for the first time, used to illustrate direct biological impacts of climate change.

highlights.title: US dams sinking and associated climate risks
highlights.details: Washington Post article (with archive link) on structural issues and subsidence affecting US dams, framed within climate and infrastructure risk.

highlights.title: Retraction of foundational glyphosate safety paper
highlights.details: Mastodon post noting that a seminal 25-year-old paper underpinning claims of glyphosate safety has been retracted, raising questions about regulatory assumptions and pesticide risk assessments.

highlights.title: Copernicus Marine Service Jupyter notebook tutorials
highlights.details: Copernicus offers Jupyter-based e-learning materials on environmental monitoring and analysis, highlighted as a potentially valuable resource for environmental OSINT practitioners.

highlights.title: Cafeteria menu swap reduces carbon footprint by ~30%
highlights.details: Short video showing that simply reordering dishes in a canteen menu led to a roughly 30% reduction in carbon emissions from food choices, illustrating the impact of behavioral nudges.
